intro: Kentrophyllum album, commonly known as the white kentrophyllum, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive white, waxy leaves that reflect sunlight. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white in color. Kentrophyllum album thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
